intro: Goniophlebium rigidulum, commonly known as the rigid flat moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. The plant has a short, stout stem with leaves that are strongly recurved and often have a distinct midrib. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks. Goniophlebium rigidulum is a cryptogamic plant that plays a role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its habitat.
